examples.german: ein schöner, klarer, lauer, stiller, schwüler, sommerlicher, frischer, herbstlicher, nebliger, kühler, trüber, dunkler, stürmischer Abend
examples.english: a beautiful, clear, lukewarm, quiet, sultry, summery, fresh, autumnal, foggy, cool, cloudy, dark, stormy evening

examples.german: der erste, letzte, gestrige, folgende Abend
examples.english: the first, last, yesterday, the following evening

examples.german: gestern, heute, morgen Abend , Freitag Abend
examples.english: yesterday, today, tomorrow evening, Friday evening

examples.german: er kommt, aber sein Vater ist verhindert
examples.english: he comes, but his father is prevented

examples.german: wir schliefen schon, die Mutter aber wachte noch
examples.english: we were already asleep mother but still awake

examples.german: ich kenne ihn nicht, aber seinen Bruder
examples.english: I don't know him, but I know his brother

etymology: butAdv. and conj., as an always emphasized adv., expresses multiple repetition from 'again(in order), again, once again', gradually suppressed since the 16th century by again(s. d.), today only in certain combinations such as but and but(again) ('again and again'), thousands and thousands ('many thousands'), hundreds and hundreds, as a conj. describes the opposition '(ever), however, against', restricts an assertion 'however, of course, after all', reinforces an assertion, request 'really', expresses V...

examples.german: Mit zwanzig Minuten Verspätung fahren wir ab – Bahnalltag in Österreich eben.
examples.english: We leave twenty minutes late – everyday railway life in Austria.

examples.german: die Störche sind schon nach Süden abgeflogen
examples.english: the storks have already flown south

examples.german: er ist (von A.) nach B. abgeflogen
